item.title: Sandra Oh, Andy Samberg to host the Golden Globe Awards gala - UPI.com
item.description:

"Killing Eve" star Sandra Oh and "Brooklyn Nine-Nine" actor Andy Samberg are set to co-host the Golden Globe Awards, NBC announced Wednesday.

item.title: Sandra Oh and Andy Samberg will team up to host 2019 Golden Globe Awards - CNN
item.description:
Sandra Oh and Andy Samberg will team up to host 2019 Golden Globe Awards  CNN

Oh, yes. On the eve of Golden Globe nominations, the Hollywood Foreign Press Association announced it has tapped "Killing Eve" star Sandra Oh and "Brooklyn Nine-Nine's" Andy Samberg to host the 2019 awards ceremony. It will mark Oh and Samberg's first time co-hosting together, but it will not be their first time appearing on a big stage side by side. Oh and Samberg presented an award together at the Emmy Awards in September, executing a well-timed banter that earned their short appearance praise. Apparently, it was enough to earn them an even bigger gig. Samberg previously served as sole ho...

item.title: 'Jizz in My Pants' Marked a Turning Point in Internet History - VICE
item.description:
'Jizz in My Pants' Marked a Turning Point in Internet History  VICE

This article originally appeared on VICE UK. On December 6, 2008, The Lonely Island premiered "Jizz in My Pants" on Saturday Night Live. That same evening it was uploaded to their YouTube channel, where it instantly became one of the most viewed videos on the platform, quickly overtaking that OK GO one with the treadmills. As a result, "Jizz in My Pants" commanded airplay on national radio. So, for a time, it could be heard nestled conspicuously between the likes of Britney Spears' "Womanizer" and TI's "Live Your Life." Some stations wouldn’t allow the word “jizz” on air, because obviously,...

item.title: Andy Samberg And Sandra Oh To Host The 2019 Golden Globes - HuffPost
item.description:
Andy Samberg And Sandra Oh To Host The 2019 Golden Globes  HuffPost

Actress Sandra Oh and comedian Andy Samberg will reunite onstage as hosts of the 2019 Golden Globe Awards, set to air Jan. 6 on NBC. In an announcement on Wednesday, NBC Entertainment co-chairmen Paul Telegdy and George Cheeks called Oh and Samberg the “perfect choices” for the prestigious event. “They bring wit, charm and style to a room filled with the very best of film and television,” the executives said. The “Killing Eve” star and “Brooklyn Nine-Nine” comedian stole the show earlier this year while presenting an award at the Emmys together, leaving fans wanting more. Meher Tatna, presi...

item.title: Andy Samberg and Sandra Oh to Host 2019 Golden Globes - The Daily Beast
item.description:
Andy Samberg and Sandra Oh to Host 2019 Golden Globes  The Daily Beast

Mario Anzuoni/Reuters,Actors Andy Samberg and Sandra Oh are set to host the 2019 Golden Globe Awards on Jan. 6. The surprise duo was locked down with only 32 days to go until the live show airs on NBC. Oh and Samberg presented together at the 2018 Emmys and came through with one of the night’s better comedic offerings. Oh won a Golden Globe in 2006 for her beloved portrayal of doctor Christina Yang on Grey’s Anatomy and was nominated for outstanding lead actress in a drama series last year for her performance in the BBC America drama Killing Eve. Samberg, who stars on the NBC comedy Brookly...

item.title: Sandra Oh and Andy Samberg announced as Golden Globes hosts - The Telegraph
item.description:
Sandra Oh and Andy Samberg announced as Golden Globes hosts  The Telegraph

Sandra Oh and Andy Samberg will share host duties at the Golden Globe Awards. On Wednesday , producers announced the co-hosts for the ceremony, which will take place on January 6. The Globes are hosted by the Hollywood Foreign Press Association, which presents awards for film and TV. Nominees will be announced Thursday morning. Oh won a 2006 Golden Globe for Grey's Anatomy. This year, she became the first actress of Asian ethnicity to receive an Emmy nomination for drama series lead, for Killing Eve. Samberg won two Golden Globes in 2014 for Brooklyn Nine-Nine, for best comedy actor and as ...

item.title: Andy Samberg, Sandra Oh Tapped to Host 2019 Golden Globes Ceremony - TVLine
item.description:
Andy Samberg, Sandra Oh Tapped to Host 2019 Golden Globes Ceremony  TVLine

After giving one heck of an audition at this year’s Emmy Awards, Andy Samberg and Sandra Oh got the gig: The Brooklyn Nine-Nine and Killing Eve stars will co-host the 76th Annual Golden Globes, TVLine has learned. “Sandra and Andy are the perfect choices to host this world-class event,” said Paul Telegdy and George Cheeks, co-chairmen of NBC Entertainment. “They bring wit, charm and style to a room filled with the very best of film and television. It’s sure to be another unforgettable fun-filled night.” Added Meher Tatna, president of the Hollywood Foreign Press Association: “We’re excited ...

item.title: Sandra Oh Will Host The Golden Globes! Also Andy Samberg - Refinery29
item.description:
Sandra Oh Will Host The Golden Globes! Also Andy Samberg  Refinery29

NBC has announced that Killing Eve star Sandra Oh and Brooklyn Nine-Nine star Andy Samberg will host the 2019 Golden Globes. As far as 2018 was concerned, these stars pretty much came out on top. Killing Eve rocketed Oh back into the spotlight, and earned her an Emmy nod for her performance as the titular character. Brooklyn Nine-Nine also made headlines after Fox had cancelled the show — fans were immediately distraught, and NBC swooped in to save it. In September, Oh and Samberg were celebrated as one of the best bits of the 2018 Emmys. The duo presented the Emmy for Outstanding Directing...

item.title: Golden Globes: Andy Samberg & Sandra Oh To Co-Host 2019 Awards On NBC - Deadline
item.description:
Golden Globes: Andy Samberg & Sandra Oh To Co-Host 2019 Awards On NBC  Deadline

A month before the 2019 Golden Globes and a day before nominations are announced, Brooklyn Nine-Nine star Andy Samberg and Killing Eve’s Sandra Oh have been named co-hosts for the Jan. 6 ceremony. This is only the second time the Golden Globes has been hosted by a duo, following the three-year stint of Samberg’s former Saturday Night Live colleagues Tina Fey and Amy Poehler. Samberg was the obvious choice to host the awards. He is a Golden Globe winner for Brooklyn Nine-Nine and the series, also a Golden Globe recipient for best comedy-musical, launches on NBC Jan. 10, four days after the G...

item.title: Sandra Oh and Andy Samberg Are Hosting the Golden Globes? We're Surprised AND Delighted - POPSUGAR
item.description:
Sandra Oh and Andy Samberg Are Hosting the Golden Globes? We're Surprised AND Delighted  POPSUGAR

We officially have a host for the 2019 Golden Globes Awards, and it's . . . Sandra Oh and Andy Samberg?! The two have never been in a film of TV project together, but they proved they have excellent chemistry while presenting at the Emmy Awards in September of this year. In the hilarious bit, Oh ripped up the envelope that named the winner for outstanding directing in a comedy series, saying she "had a moment" and got overwhelmed." She then starts panicking and announces La La Land as the winner. The joke about the infamous 2017 Oscars slip-up was funny in itself, but clearly Oh and Samberg...

item.title: Sandra Oh and Andy Samberg to co-host 2019 Golden Globes - The Guardian
item.description:
Sandra Oh and Andy Samberg to co-host 2019 Golden Globes  The Guardian

Sandra Oh and Andy Samberg have been announced as hosts of the 2019 Golden Globes. The Killing Eve star and the Brooklyn Nine-Nine comedian will follow in the footsteps of this year’s host, Seth Meyers, next January. The pair presented together at that ceremony, ridiculing the La La Land snafu in a warmly received skit. Related: Oscars host Kevin Hart's homophobia is no laughing matter | Benjamin Lee “We’re excited to welcome Sandra Oh and Andy Samberg as co-hosts of Hollywood’s party of the year,” said the Hollywood Foreign Press Association (HFPA) president, Meher Tatna. “Both Golden Glob...

item.title: Golden Globes 2019 Will Be Hosted By Andy Samberg & Sandra Oh - The Inquisitr News
item.description:
Golden Globes 2019 Will Be Hosted By Andy Samberg & Sandra Oh  The Inquisitr News

The hosts of the 2019 Golden Globes have been made official. Andy Samberg and Sandra have been chosen to host the 76th edition of the awards show, according to a report by E! News. In a statement released announcing the news, Paul Telegdy and George Cheeks, the co-chairmen of NBC Entertainment said, “Sandra and Andy are the perfect choices to host this world-class event. They bring wit, charm, and style to a room filled with the very best of film and television. It’s sure to be another unforgettable, fun-filled night.” The duo follow some entertainment royalty in leading the festivities and...

item.title: Your 2019 Golden Globe Awards Hosts Are Sandra Oh and Andy Samberg - Jezebel
item.description:
Your 2019 Golden Globe Awards Hosts Are Sandra Oh and Andy Samberg  Jezebel

Image: AP For me the Golden Globes is a slideshow of regal outfits and, about five hours later, a list of prize-winners, for I have little curiosity as to what Ricky Gervais, Jimmy Fallon, and Seth Meyers have to say (Tina Fey and Amy Poehler being the notable recent exceptions). But this I would watch. Deadline reported on Wednesday that next year’s hosts have been announced and they are Andy Samberg (Brooklyn Nine-Nine) and Sandra Oh (Killing Eve). Oh will be the first person of color ever to host the event. The ceremony will also be distinguished for having two hosts, a rare occurrence m...

item.title: Sandra Oh & Andy Samberg Will Join Forces To Host The 2019 Golden Globe Awards - OK!
item.description:
Sandra Oh & Andy Samberg Will Join Forces To Host The 2019 Golden Globe Awards  OK!

It’s that time of year again! Award season is upon us and the first one on the list is the 2019 Golden Globe Awards. It was just announced that Sandra Oh and Andy Samberg will host the illustrious event. It’s sure to be one funny party! The two previously appeared on stage together at the 2018 Emmy Awards in September. Their presenting bit had them parodying the infamous La La Land/ Moonlight 2017 Oscars mixup. Getty The Hollywood Foreign Press Association’s President, Meher Tatna announced the news in a statement earlier today. Getty "We’re excited to welcome Sandra Oh and Andy Samberg as ...

item.title: Watch SNL: A Saturday Night Live Christmas special - Hidden Remote
item.description:
Watch SNL: A Saturday Night Live Christmas special  Hidden Remote

Can't wait to watch tonight's Saturday Night Live Christmas special? Here's all you need to know to be sure you tune in to SNL! If you loved SNL's special Thanksgiving episode, you won't want to miss tonight's Saturday Night Live Best of Christmas! Specials, you gotta love them, and the sketch series is one of the best at them. It's the holiday season! What better thing to do than watch Christmas movies and TV episodes, including one very special one from SNL. Tonight's episode may not be all-new, but it doesn't make it any less interesting. In fact, it's one of our favorites! What exactly ...

item.title: What's The Difference Between The Academy Awards & The Golden Globes? - Refinery29
item.description:
What's The Difference Between The Academy Awards & The Golden Globes?  Refinery29

According to the unofficial holiday handbook, Christmas starts the day after Thanksgiving. Today, with the release of 2019 Golden Globes nominations, the other important winter season unofficially began: award show season. Considering the vast majority of us aren’t nominated for anything, keeping up with Hollywood’s award season is a bit of an ask. There are multiple award shows, each with their own quirks and voting processes. Amid the landscape of film awards season, two award shows stand out as being particularly prestigious (and fun to watch): the Golden Globes and the Academy Awards, k...

item.title: Sandra Oh, Andy Samberg to host Golden Globe ceremony - The Associated Press
item.description:
Sandra Oh, Andy Samberg to host Golden Globe ceremony  The Associated Press

LOS ANGELES (AP) — Sandra Oh and Andy Samberg will share host duties at the Golden Globe Awards. Producers on Wednesday announced the co-hosts for the Jan. 6 ceremony. The Globes are hosted by the Hollywood Foreign Press Association, which presents awards for film and TV. Nominees will be announced Thursday morning. Oh won a 2006 Golden Globe for "Grey's Anatomy." This year, she became the first actress of Asian ethnicity to receive an Emmy nomination for drama series lead, for "Killing Eve." Samberg won two Golden Globes in 2014 for "Brooklyn Nine-Nine," for best comedy actor and as a prod...

item.title: Golden Globes 2019: Andy Samberg and Sandra Oh named as hosts for awards ceremony - The Independent
item.description:
Golden Globes 2019: Andy Samberg and Sandra Oh named as hosts for awards ceremony  The Independent

Canadian actress Sandra Oh and US comedian Andy Samberg have been named as the hosts of the 2019 Golden Globe Awards, the organisers have announced. The pair, who recently presented a prize at the Emmy awards, will the making their debut as hosts for the ceremony, which is due to take place at the Beverly Hills Hilton on January 6. Nominations for the awards, which honour the film the television industries, will be announced on Thursday. “Sandra and Andy are the perfect choices to host this world-class event,” Paul Telegdy and George Cheeks, co-chairmen of NBC Entertainment, said in a state...

item.title: Here's When the 2019 Emmy Awards Will Air - TV Guide
item.description:
Here's When the 2019 Emmy Awards Will Air  TV Guide

Are you ready to start thinking about the Emmys again? If not, you better prepare yourself, because the 71st Primetime Emmy Awards ceremony has an airdate. The show will air live coast-to-coast on Sunday, Sept. 22 on Fox, the network announced Monday. The host and producers will be announced at a later date. The last time the ceremony was on Fox, Brooklyn Nine-Nine's Andy Samberg hosted, but he will likely not be back since Brooklyn Nine-Nine has since moved to NBC. The 71st Emmy Awards will recognize excellence in TV for the eligibility period of June 2018 through May 2019. Expect a strong...

item.title: SNL’s New Rap Parodies Tell the Same Old Joke - The Atlantic
item.description:
SNL’s New Rap Parodies Tell the Same Old Joke  The Atlantic

Ruth Bader Ginsburg has been a fake hip-hop icon since at least 2013, when the nickname Notorious RBG went viral, thereby finally informing the venerated justice of the existence of Biggie Smalls. But she didn’t get her big-budget debut single until this past weekend. “Supreme Court’s a boys’ club, she holds it down, no cares given,” rapped a shirtless, chain-wearing Chris Redd on Saturday Night Live, while Kate McKinnon’s imitation Ginsburg shook up a beer from the bench. “Who else got six movies about ’em who’s still livin’?” The song’s the latest in a resurgent SNL genre: hip-hop parody....

item.title: Saturday Night Live review: Pete Davidson gets roasted by Dan Crenshaw - Bam! Smack! Pow!
item.description:
Saturday Night Live review: Pete Davidson gets roasted by Dan Crenshaw  Bam! Smack! Pow!

Somehow, Saturday Night Live once again became the Pete Davidson show, while host Liev Scheiber gave some great performances as the host. Move over hosts and musical guests and pretty much anyone else involved in Saturday Night Live. Someway, somehow, Saturday Night Live has become all about addressing the things going on with Pete Davidson right now. Yes, last week he made quite the no-no by making fun of wounded Navy SEAL veteran Dan Crenshaw, who is now elected to Congress. And it does seem appropriate that the show took the time to address the controversy (read below to see how the two ...

item.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine premiere date revealed, what's in store for season 6? - FanSided
item.description:
Brooklyn Nine-Nine premiere date revealed, what's in store for season 6?  FanSided

NBC recently surprised fans with news of Brooklyn Nine-Nine's move to Thursday nights. Now, the network has revealed its premiere date and much sooner than anticipated. After NBC acquired Brooklyn Nine-Nine and renewed it for a sixth season, many of us expected an extended hiatus between seasons. Though, it looks like fans will be receiving a late New Year's treat. The first episode of Brooklyn Nine-Nine Season 6 will air on January 10, 2019, with each episode becoming available on Hulu the following day. The streamer currently hosts all five seasons of the series and we should expect the s...

item.title: ‘Brooklyn Nine-Nine’ Season 6′ Teaser: NBC Welcomes Canceled-And-Revived Cop Comedy - Deadline
item.description:
‘Brooklyn Nine-Nine’ Season 6′ Teaser: NBC Welcomes Canceled-And-Revived Cop Comedy  Deadline

It’s been nearly six months since Fox canceled its cop comedy Brooklyn Nine-Nine after five seasons and NBC re-cuffed just a day later. Now we have our first brief look at Season 6 of the series starring Andy Samberg as an NYPD detective and his wacky colleagues in the 99th Precinct. Take a look above. The 15-second clip doesn’t offer much in the way of plot reveals, but it appears to show the characters celebrating at the local watering hole. You might recall that, in what could have been the series finale, Season 5’s cliffhanger saw Captain Ray Holt (Andre Braugher, a three-time Emmy nomi...

item.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine Season 6 Finally Gets a Premiere Date! - TV Guide
item.description:
Brooklyn Nine-Nine Season 6 Finally Gets a Premiere Date!  TV Guide

NBC unveiled the January premiere dates for several of it shows and we finally know when new episodes of Brooklyn Nine-Nine are headed your way. Mark your calendars because the cop comedy starring Andy Samberg returns for Season 6 on Thursday, Jan. 10 at 9/8c. Meanwhile, Dwayne Johnson heads back to TV to host the new athletic competition series The Titan Games on Thursday, Jan. 3 at 8/7c. The two-hour premiere will feature competitors participating in endurance-based mental and physical challenges in order to become a member of an elite group known as Titans. These giants will challenge ne...

item.title: ABC Buys ‘Because Kids’ Comedy Inspired By Atomic Moms Podcast From Adam Sztykiel, Ellie Knaus & Party Over Here - Deadline
item.description:
ABC Buys ‘Because Kids’ Comedy Inspired By Atomic Moms Podcast From Adam Sztykiel, Ellie Knaus & Party Over Here  Deadline

ABC has landed for development Because Kids, a half-hour family comedy inspired by the Atomic Moms podcast, from Undateable creator Adam Sztykiel and his wife Ellie Knaus, who created and hosts the podcast, Lonely Island’s production shingle Party Over Here, and CBS TV Studios. Co-created and written by husband and wife writing team Sztykiel and Knaus, Because Kids is inspired by the Atomic Moms podcast as well as the experiences of every parent involved with the project. It’s described as a multi-generational comedy that is a lighthearted yet honest examination of the lives of a married co...

item.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine season 6 – everything we know so far - NME Live
item.description:
Brooklyn Nine-Nine season 6 – everything we know so far  NME Live

The show was cancelled by Fox, but was renewed by NBC after an online fan outry It’s the cult comedy favourite about a dysfunctional Brooklyn police crew that – to the surprise of many – won lead Andy Samberg a Best Actor Golden Globe in 2014. This was surprising because Sandberg, one-third of comic musical duo The Lonely Island, is more renowned for his talent as a comedian than his acting chops. Yet he makes Brooklyn Nine-Nine anessential show, bringing masses of charm to his role as Jake Peralta, a brilliant but childish cop whose Police Captain, Raymond Holt, wants to knock him into sha...

item.title: SNL hires its first female directing duo with Hannah Levy and Adriana Robles - Fast Company
item.description:
SNL hires its first female directing duo with Hannah Levy and Adriana Robles  Fast Company

Saturday Night Live‘s digital shorts have become a fixture in the show’s ecosystem as the birthplace of instant gems like “Dick in a Box,” “Natalie’s Rap,” and of course, “Lazy Sunday.” The Lonely Island team, consisting of Jorma Taccone, Akiva Schaffer, and former SNL cast member Andy Samberg, ushered in the digital shorts back in 2005, and went on to write and direct the vast majority of its catalog, with a smattering of other voices at the helm over the years–all of whom had one thing in common: They’re men. However, with SNL having launched its 44th season this fall, there’s some new an...

item.title: How Brooklyn Nine-Nine Actress Stephanie Beatriz Incorporated the Hit Show Into Her Wedding - Brides
item.description:
How Brooklyn Nine-Nine Actress Stephanie Beatriz Incorporated the Hit Show Into Her Wedding  Brides

Brooklyn Nine-Nine's Stephanie Beatriz has tied the knot! The actress married Brad Hoss over the weekend in a Los Angeles-themed bash with so many personal touches—including one that showcased her fan-favorite show, Brooklyn Nine-Nine. "We decided that we wanted it to really reflect us," Beatriz told People of her wedding. "So for us that meant being involved every step of the way, meaning that we didn’t hire a wedding planner. We did it ourselves, which is a pretty big undertaking when you consider there’s gonna be close to 300 people there.” Although we're practically sweating just thinki...

item.title: Brooklyn Nine Nine Losing Star Chelsea Peretti - GameSpot
item.description:
Brooklyn Nine Nine Losing Star Chelsea Peretti  GameSpot

Brooklyn Nine Nine star Chelsea Peretti is dropping out of the series. She'll be in some episodes of the upcoming sixth season, but not all of them, it seems. "I won't be doing a full season of Brooklyn Nine Nine in Season 6," she wrote on Twitter. "But that doesn't mean I won't ever be back..." B99 fans. Hiiiiiiiiiiii. Chelsea Peretti, here. I won't be doing a full season of Brooklyn Nine Nine in Season 6. But that doesn’t mean I won’t ever be back, winky face emoji, heart emoji. I want to thank you for the hours you spent watching Gina be Gina: — Chelsea Peretti (@chelseaperetti) October ...

item.title: 2018 Emmys: ‘SNL’ wins the Emmy for outstanding variety sketch series - Mic
item.description:
2018 Emmys: ‘SNL’ wins the Emmy for outstanding variety sketch series  Mic

NBC’s Saturday Night Live won the award for outstanding variety sketch series during Monday night’s 70th annual Emmy Awards. Creator and producer Lorne Michaels accepted the award on behalf of the show. SNL’s talent was all over the awards show on Monday night — SNL’s Colin Jost and Michael Che hosted, and the night featured appearances from current and former SNL cast members like Leslie Jones, Aidy Bryant, Andy Samberg and Maya Rudolph. SNL beat out other critically acclaimed shows to win the trophy. The category’s other nominees included TruTV’s At Home With Amy Sedaris, Comedy Central’s...

item.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine Season 6: Jake and Amy's developing relationship - FanSided
item.description:
Brooklyn Nine-Nine Season 6: Jake and Amy's developing relationship  FanSided

In the Season 5 Finale of Brooklyn Nine-Nine, Jake and Amy took another step in cementing their relationship with one another. The question is, how has their relationship developed since then? Warning! Spoilers for Season 5 of Brooklyn Nine-Nine follow. You've been warned. Ever since Jake Peralta (Andy Samberg) and Amy Santiago (Melissa Fumero) sparked up a fiery relationship on Brooklyn Nine-Nine, fans have been eagerly waiting for them to tie the knot. It took them a considerable amount of time to wrap their heads around the idea of marriage, but they ultimately did. Currently, the concer...

item.title: ‘Brooklyn Nine-Nine’ Gets Expanded 18-Episode Order On NBC - Deadline
item.description:
‘Brooklyn Nine-Nine’ Gets Expanded 18-Episode Order On NBC  Deadline

NBC is adding five episodes to its original 13-episode order for praised cop comedy series Brooklyn Nine-Nine, bringing the total to 18 episodes for the 2018-19 season. Season 6 of Brooklyn Nine-Nine will premiere midseason on NBC. NBC picked up the Andy Samberg-starring comedy following its cancellation by Fox last spring. The network, whose sister studio Universal TV produces the series, was one of the potential suitors for the comedy after its cancellation. NBC also was among the broadcast networks that bid for the Brooklyn Nine-Nine pitch from creators Mike Schur and Dan Goor when it hi...

item.title: 'Brooklyn Nine-Nine' May Get A Me Too Storyline - HuffPost
item.description:
'Brooklyn Nine-Nine' May Get A Me Too Storyline  HuffPost

“Brooklyn Nine-Nine” may explore the Me Too movement in an upcoming episode of the police sitcom. Showrunner Dan Goor hinted at the possibility of a Me Too plot line during a panel at the Television Critics Association’s summer press tour on Wednesday. Goor, along with cast members including Andy Samberg and Terry Crews, agreed that a storyline centering around sexual misconduct would fit with the Fox series’ trend of highlighting timely subjects. “They are really hard to do, but we’re happy with the way they turn out,” Goor said, according to Deadline. “The challenge is to stay true to th...

item.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine may tackle #MeToo in upcoming season - Bam! Smack! Pow!
item.description:
Brooklyn Nine-Nine may tackle #MeToo in upcoming season  Bam! Smack! Pow!

The law enforcement comedy could become the latest show to take on #MeToo subject matter, showrunner Dan Goor revealed at TCA. Brooklyn Nine-Nine is considering a #MeToo-themed storyline for its upcoming sixth season. The ensemble comedy's cast and showrunner, Dan Goor, spoke about the possibility at the Television Critics Association's summer press tour. Goor and Andy Samberg, who plays Detective Jake Peralta, stressed that the show's creatives would only integrate a #MeToo plotline if they could figure out a way to do it right. They referenced "Moo Moo," an episode about racism in law enf...

item.title: ‘Friends’ is revealed as the UK’s most-watched streaming show - NME Live
item.description:
‘Friends’ is revealed as the UK’s most-watched streaming show  NME Live

14 years after the sitcom ended Fans were quick to binge watch all 10 seasons once it arrived on Netflix ‘Friends’ has been revealed as the UK’s most-watched streaming show, 14 years after its last episode aired on TV. - Read more: This is the nation’s favourite ‘Friends’ character The US sitcom arrived on Netflix back in January, with subscribers able to binge watch all 10 seasons. Repeats of the show were broadcast on Channel 4 and E4 until 2011. While Netflix and Amazon don’t publish their own viewing figures, new data has been released by TV watchdog Ofcom, revealing the classic sitcom ...

item.title: Cuckoo, series 4 ep 1, review: there's still life and laughs in this daft family comedy - The Telegraph
item.description:
Cuckoo, series 4 ep 1, review: there's still life and laughs in this daft family comedy  The Telegraph

Cuckoo(BBC One) got off to a joyful start, two years on from the happy-ever-after ending of its third series. Hyper-enthusiastic American Dale (Taylor Lautner) was still riding love’s euphoric wave after securing his relationship with Rachel (Esther Smith), while her father Ken (Greg Davies) was thrilled to be nominated for Lichfield’s Lawyer of the Year award. This haphazard family sitcom has been a quiet success ever since it began in 2012; it was something of an oddity for having a fresh-out-of Saturday Night Live American comedian as its eponymous star. Andy Samberg appeared for that fi...

item.title: Cuckoo season four review – the further flights of fancy of Ken and Dale - The Guardian
item.description:
Cuckoo season four review – the further flights of fancy of Ken and Dale  The Guardian

You cannot turn your back on Cuckoo (BBC Three) for a minute. In its first incarnation, this British sitcom – BBC Three’s highest rated comedy debut – was about a gap-year student called Rachel who returned home from her travels with a moronic hippy husband called Cuckoo in tow, played by Brooklyn Nine-Nine’s Andy Samberg. Other commitments ended Samberg’s participation after series one. The show might have died there, but they killed off Cuckoo instead. In series two, Twilight’s Taylor Lautner stepped in as Cuckoo’s long-lost son Dale, playing opposite a new Rachel (Esther Smith). Their co...

item.title: Andy Samberg says it’s a “good moment” for inclusive comedy to distance from Fox - Salon
item.description:
Andy Samberg says it’s a “good moment” for inclusive comedy to distance from Fox  Salon

Paul A. Hebert/invision/ap This article originally appeared on IndieWire.. “Brooklyn Nine-Nine” has always been built with positive energy, a diverse cast, and progressive ideas. Storylines in the Emmy- and Golden Globe-winning sitcom have tackled important topics like police profiling and bisexual representation with nuance, honesty, and — above all else — a caring heart. These adjectives may not come to mind when watching Fox News, a division of 21st Century Fox, which is the same corporation that used to distribute “Brooklyn Nine-Nine” via its Fox television network. Now that the series ...

item.title: ‘Brooklyn Nine-Nine’ Cast & Creators On Season 6, LGBTQ Representation, & An ‘SVU’ Crossover? – Comic-Con - Deadline
item.description:
‘Brooklyn Nine-Nine’ Cast & Creators On Season 6, LGBTQ Representation, & An ‘SVU’ Crossover? – Comic-Con  Deadline

The canceled and then quickly renewed Brooklyn Nine-Nine busted into San Diego Comic-Con like a drug raid and it was probably the rowdiest and most fan-driven panel on the first day of the confab — or as the kids say, it was “lit AF.” The crowd erupted with off-the-charts applause as show creators Luke Del Tredici and Dan Goor were joined on the stage by stars Andy Samberg, Melissa Fumero, Terry Crews, Stephanie Beatriz, Joe Lo Truglio, Chelsea Peretti, Dirk Blocker, and Joel McKinnon Keller. Unfortunately, Andre Braugher was not in attendance to which Samberg joked that he sent a message a...

item.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine crew knocks Fox News, calling NBC move ‘good moment to switch’ - Polygon
item.description:
Brooklyn Nine-Nine crew knocks Fox News, calling NBC move ‘good moment to switch’  Polygon

Fox Andy Samberg joins other Hollywood celebrities in knocking Fox News At Thursday night’s San Diego Comic-Con panel for Brooklyn Nine-Nine, Andy Samberg and his fellow cast members celebrated their show’s pickup at NBC by addressing a question everyone’s had on their mind since: How do they feel about the switch from Fox to NBC? Samberg addressed a fan’s question about Fox’s cancellation in the most typical Samberg way: with a joke, followed by a moment of sincerity. “They’re not afraid to say the true stuff, so in that regard it was hard for us,” Samberg said, joking about Fox News’ rela...

item.title: Andy Samberg Has a New Late-Night Gig: Being a Dad - The New York Times
item.description:
Andy Samberg Has a New Late-Night Gig: Being a Dad  The New York Times

Mr. Samberg talks about “Hotel Transylvania 3: Summer Vacation,” NBC’s rescue of “Brooklyn Nine-Nine,” and how fatherhood is a little like “S.N.L.”

item.title: Selena Gomez and Andy Samberg Take a "Where Should You Go on Summer Vacation?" Quiz - POPSUGAR
item.description:
Selena Gomez and Andy Samberg Take a "Where Should You Go on Summer Vacation?" Quiz  POPSUGAR

Selena Gomez and Andy Samberg are back with their favorite monsters once again for Hotel Transylvania 3: Summer Vacation - but this time, the crew is headed on a luxury monster cruise ship for their ultimate Summer vacay. So in celebration of the new animated film, we had Selena and Andy take POPSUGAR's "Where Should You Go on Summer Vacation?" quiz, where they answered everything from their ideal Summer vacation activity . . . . . . to their favorite song of the Summer. Watch the video above to see it all go down, and check out Hotel Transylvania 3: Summer Vacation, now in theaters everywh...

item.title: ‘Hotel Transylvania 3’ Beats Dwayne Johnson’s ‘Skyscraper’ - The Daily Beast
item.description:
‘Hotel Transylvania 3’ Beats Dwayne Johnson’s ‘Skyscraper’  The Daily Beast

Stephane Mahe/Reuters, Dwayne Johnson was passed up in favor of monsters in theaters this weekend, as Skyscraper proved to be no match for Hotel Transylvania 3: Summer Vacation. Hotel Transylvania 3, an animated family film from Sony featuring the voices of Adam Sandler, Selena Gomez, and Andy Samberg, opened to $44 million domestically, easily winning first place. The film scored the second-best opening for the franchise, topping the original 2012 film’s $42 million. Despite Johnson’s star power, the action flick Skyscraper fell short of expectations in its opening weekend, earning $25 mil...

item.title: This Week In Pete Davidson & Ariana Grande, Mac Miller Returns - Refinery29
item.description:
This Week In Pete Davidson & Ariana Grande, Mac Miller Returns  Refinery29

With her new single and video, "God Is A Woman," out now, Ariana Grande is ending the week with a bang. However, she's not the only artist releasing new music. Her ex Mac Miller, from whom she split shortly before entering into the Pete Davidson whirlwind, has finally broken his silence. While Miller's new single, "Self Care," doesn't address the situation directly, it does have some lyrics that certainly hint to Grande's change of heart. But before we get into that, so much more happened with the couple of the summer this week that it's hard to know where to begin. Davidson has blonde hair...

item.title: Selena Gomez Will Break Her Silence For Only One Engagement - Refinery29
item.description:
Selena Gomez Will Break Her Silence For Only One Engagement  Refinery29

While the world was waiting to hear what Selena Gomez had to say about Justin Bieber's engagement to Hailey Baldwin (seriously, can we please just let Gomez live?) someone thought to ask her a different hard-hitting question. How does Gomez feel about Ariana Grande and Pete Davidson getting hitched? In an interview with Clevver News pegged to Hotel Transylvania 3, Gomez was asked how her vampiric character Mavis might feel about the quick engagement between the "No Tears Left To Cry" songstress and the Saturday Night Live star. The 13 Reasons Why producer joked that she had no idea what Mav...

item.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine stars Melissa Fumero, Stephanie Beatriz to guest on One Day at a Time - Entertainment Weekly News
item.description:
Brooklyn Nine-Nine stars Melissa Fumero, Stephanie Beatriz to guest on One Day at a Time  Entertainment Weekly News

Dimitrios Kambouris/Getty Images This casting’s certainly cool, cool, cool, cool, cool, cool. No doubt. Well, maybe it should be warm, warm, warm? Brooklyn Nine-Nine star Melissa Fumero (a.k.a. Amy) announced on Twitter Tuesday that she and costar Stephanie Beatriz (a.k.a. Rosa) will leave the New York borough for a brief stint in Los Angeles, as guest stars in season 3 of Netflix’s One Day at a Time. Fumero unveiled the news with a boomerang clip literally unveiling the two from behind the iconic curtain used by Rita Moreno’s Lydia. Guess who’s coming to hang with the Alvarez family!?!! @i...

item.title: Review: 'Hotel Transylvania 3' Is Blah (Blah Blah) - Forbes Now
item.description:
Review: 'Hotel Transylvania 3' Is Blah (Blah Blah)  Forbes Now

‘Hotel Transylvania 3′ The Box Office: After a sneak release in Australia starting on July 1, a run that has thus-far netted it $5.7 million, Sony Animation will debut Hotel Transylvania 3: Summer Vacation globally this Friday. It is one of only three major animated films this season, alongside Walt Disney’s Incredibles 2 and Warner Bros./Time Warner Inc.’s Teen Titans Go to the Movies on July 27. Yeah, the Adam Sandler/Selena Gomez/Andy Samberg comedy is the only toon this summer that isn’t about superheroes, which may give it a slight edge. The last two films were critical and commercial ...

item.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine's Melissa Fumero, Stephanie Beatriz to guest on One Day at a Time season 3 - FanSided
item.description:
Brooklyn Nine-Nine's Melissa Fumero, Stephanie Beatriz to guest on One Day at a Time season 3  FanSided

The cast for One Day at a Time season 3 just keeps getting more star power as Melissa Fumero and Stephanie Beatriz will guest star. On the heels of the announcement that Gloria Estefan will guest star in One Day at a Time season 3 as the sister of Rita Moreno's character, the Netflix Original series has cast, even more, star power. Brooklyn Nine-Nine stars Melissa Fumero and Stephanie Beatriz will have a guest starring appearance in the upcoming season due out in 2019. This is a huge deal and this announcement was teased by Mike Royce and Gloria Calderon Kellet teased fans with the day befo...

item.title: Andy Samberg supports Brooklyn Nine-Nine costar Terry Crews after testimony - Entertainment Weekly News
item.description:
Andy Samberg supports Brooklyn Nine-Nine costar Terry Crews after testimony  Entertainment Weekly News

Christopher Polk/Getty Images; Paula Lobo/ABC/Getty Images Andy Samberg is “proud” of his Brooklyn Nine-Nine costar Terry Crews, who faced jokes from rapper 50 Cent after testifying before a Senate committee for the Sexual Assault Survivors’ Bill of Rights on Tuesday. “We have a cast text chain and we were all texting him how incredible it was,” Samberg told the Associated Press during a promotional event for Hotel Transylvania 3: Summer Vacation. “He’s a miracle. Terry’s the best guy,” he added. “I am proud to know him.” Crews recounted during a Senate hearing his claims against Adam Venit...

item.title: Terry Crews praised by co-star Andy Samberg following sexual assault testimony: 'I'm proud to know him' - The Independent
item.description:
Terry Crews praised by co-star Andy Samberg following sexual assault testimony: 'I'm proud to know him'  The Independent

Andy Samberg has heaped praise upon Terry Crews who recently accused a high-profile talent agent of sexual assault. The Brooklyn Nine-Nine actor celebrated his co-star as a “miracle” for nobly speaking out against Adam Venit whom he alleges assaulted him last year. While encouraged by his fans, the actor has seemingly faced consequences in the aftermath of his accusal having been mocked by 50 Cent. He even claims he was fired from forthcoming sequel The Expendables 4 for coming forward. “We have a cast text chain and we were all texting him how incredible it was,” Samberg told Associated Pr...

item.title: Hotel Transylvania 3 cast reads bedtime stories with Alexa - Bam! Smack! Pow!
item.description:
Hotel Transylvania 3 cast reads bedtime stories with Alexa  Bam! Smack! Pow!

Andy Samberg, Keegan-Michael Key and the Hotel Transylvania: Summer Vacation cast will read bedtime stories with Amazon Alexa. If you have an Amazon Echo or another device Alexa-compatible, you can now listen to bedtime stories from the cast of Hotel Transylvania: Summer Vacation. A new story will be added to Alexa every day from July 2 through the film's premiere on July 13. You can find the new stories from the Hotel Transylvania cast by using the voice command, "Alexa, open Hotel Transylvania," according to the press release from Amazon. MORE: Avengers Infinity War release date on DVD an...

item.title: Selena Gomez Says She's Done Sweating the Small Stuff After Her Lupus Diagnosis - POPSUGAR
item.description:
Selena Gomez Says She's Done Sweating the Small Stuff After Her Lupus Diagnosis  POPSUGAR

Selena Gomez has been an open book about her lupus battle, and on Friday, the 25-year-old singer revealed how her diagnosis changed her outlook on life. While promoting her new film, Hotel Transylvania 3, with costar Andy Samberg on Good Morning America, Selena said she doesn't "really think about anything that causes me stress anymore" and she doesn't even live in LA anymore. Selena underwent a kidney transplant surgery last Summer. Even though she initially kept the news private, she later used her platform to thank pal Francia Raisa for donating her organ and raise awareness about lupus....

item.title: ‘Hotel Transylvania 3’ Checks In Close To $1.3M From Amazon Prime Sneak Previews - Deadline
item.description:
‘Hotel Transylvania 3’ Checks In Close To $1.3M From Amazon Prime Sneak Previews  Deadline

EXCLUSIVE: It’s another successful partnership between Sony and Amazon Prime. While the two partnered up to sell early preview tickets on Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle back in December earning $1.86M before its $71.9M five-day opening, their latest marketing sneak preview collaboration on Hotel Transylvania 3: Summer Vacation racked up close to $1.3M per Deadline sources from 3PM showtimes on Friday at roughly 1,000 theaters. Note that the Transylvania 3 tickets were sold at matinee prices, whereas Jumanji was sold at an evening price. The threequel opens on July 13. Amazon Prime members w...

item.title: 25 Best TV dads on Netflix to celebrate Father’s Day - Hidden Remote
item.description:
25 Best TV dads on Netflix to celebrate Father’s Day  Hidden Remote

With Father's Day round the corner, it's time to look at the best TV dads on Netflix right now. Netflix TV dads come in all shapes and sizes. Not all of them are biologically related but take in friends' children or runaways they find. Others have wanted their children from young ages and will do anything for them. Father's Day is a time to celebrate the fathers we have—the father figures, the biological fathers, and those who step in when we need it the most. This is a chance to look at everything men do for their children, whether those children ask for it or don't. Yes, there are certain...

item.title: The Character Who Made Me Love Brooklyn Nine-Nine - The Atlantic
item.description:
The Character Who Made Me Love Brooklyn Nine-Nine  The Atlantic

When I first met Amy Santiago, she was everything I never knew I wanted in a television character. I encountered the Cuban-American NYPD detective in early 2014, after Brooklyn Nine-Nine won two Golden Globes in its first season and landed on my radar. Initially, it seemed like a formulaic comedy about an immature cop, Jake Peralta (Andy Samberg), butting heads with a new captain, Raymond Holt (Andre Braugher). Jake’s fellow officer, rival, and love interest, Amy Santiago (Melissa Fumero), appeared to be the “straight woman” to his renegade cop. I thought I knew what their dynamic would be:...

item.title: The Lonely Island Have Gone Full Circle and Are Now Underrated - VICE
item.description:
The Lonely Island Have Gone Full Circle and Are Now Underrated  VICE

In June 2016, comedy trio The Lonely Island released music mockumentary Popstar: Never Stop Never Stopping. Playing fictional popstar Conner Friel, SNL cast member Andy Samberg used the film as a vehicle to satirise music documentaries, fan entitlement and the big old beast of celebrity culture. On the one hand, it was reviewed well: Uproxx called Popstar “the best mockumentary since Spinal Tap.” On the other hand, it sunk like a disappointing anvil into the bottom of the ocean, making just $9 million back of its $20 million budget and failing to bring in the huge audience the trio had hope...

item.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine finale: See Jake and Amy's wedding threatened by a bomb (and Teddy) - Entertainment Weekly News
item.description:
Brooklyn Nine-Nine finale: See Jake and Amy's wedding threatened by a bomb (and Teddy)  Entertainment Weekly News

Brooklyn Nine-Nine will unveil its season finale-turned-series finale-turned-season finale on Sunday — in case you missed the news, there was life after death — and it is time for Jake (Andy Samberg) and Amy (Melissa Fumero) to make their bond official and walk down the aisle. There’s a Nakatomi Plaza wedding cake, Cheddar is training to fill in as ring bearer, and Gina Rodriguez is guest-starring as a possible love interest for Rosa (Stephanie Beatriz), all of this is all great, but… there’s also a bomb threat called into the venue of the nuptials. Worse yet, Amy’s ex Teddy (Kyle Bornheime...
